intro: Orophea ellipanthoides, commonly known as the elliptic orchid, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its striking, orchid-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has palm-like leaves and can grow as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
